alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northwestern Washington...northeastern Hancock and east central Penobscot Counties... At 600 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Fowler Township to 7 miles north of Grand Falls...and moving southeast AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Calais, Princeton, Springfield, Topsfield, Grand Lake Stream, Lakeville, Dyer Township, Lincoln Township, Fowler Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, Lee, Alexander, Burlington, Carroll, Waite, Codyville, Dyer and Big Lake. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Calais and Topsfield. State Highway 9 near Calais. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington
